item.description: I’m a Lean Startup Machine Winner and a VCU MBA with a focus on Data Analytics. A Prerelease Tester for Adobe and Two-time Photoshop World Guru Award Finalist.
*Make your development environment match your user’s environment as much as possible. * When possible live the experience your users will be living during the development process.
Hello Everyone! I’m Brandon. I’m a Designer & Engineer deeply interested in helping people interface more easily with their computers to get things done.

Healthcare Design Optimizing for data specificity vs time spent charting Knowing where aspects of the chart need structure vs where others should be more flexible Attempting to create linearity in an inherently non-linear field Creating clean intuitive designs with a information density preferred by clinicians Data interoperability between Health System to Health System and also Patient to Health System Reforming the cost of healthcare to incentivize better outcomes.

I always loved computers, but I didn’t associate as a Designer until likely High School. I grew up in a very small town and we only had dial up internet, but I had an excellent communications teacher, Tracy Wainwright who taught English, Yearbook, Advanced Comm (Morning News) and Newspaper.

Seth Godin Mistake proofing, or its Japanese equivalent poka-yoke (pronounced PO-ka yo-KAY), is the use of any automatic device or method that either makes it impossible for an error to occur or makes the error immediately obvious once it has occurred.

A polymath is a person who knows a lot about a lot of subjects. If your friend is not only a brilliant physics student but has also published a poetry collection and won prizes at political debates, you can describe her as a polymath.
